channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Amid political chaos, Bank of Korea says it will boost short-term liquidity and deploy measures to stabilize the FX market
item.description: The announcement came shortly after the BOK held an emergency board meeting.

item.title: Kospi heavyweight stocks fall in volatile trade after President Yoon's martial law flip-flop
item.description: South Korean heavyweight stocks fell in a volatile trading session Wednesday amid market jitters triggered by a political upheaval.

item.title: South Korean won falls, but is off lows amid political chaos in country
item.description: South Korea's won on Tuesday cut losses after the country's parliament swiftly passed a resolution to demand the lifting of martial law.

item.title: Australia's third-quarter GDP grows at a slower-than-expected 0.3% amid higher rates and sticky inflation
item.description: Australia's economy grew at slower than expected in the third quarter, as elevated borrowing costs and sticky inflation continued to weigh down on the slowing economy.

item.title: As global defense spending surges, South Korean arms makers look like a clear winner
item.description: A steady increase in global expenditure, combined with growing geopolitical uncertainties has provided South Korean arms makers with larger global markets.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. stocks began December chilly, but will probably warm up soon
item.description: December may have triggered the thawing of Mariah Carey, but stocks are beginning the month chilly, though unlikely they'll remain in permafrost this month.

item.title: The top books and experiences for the wealthy this holiday season
item.description: J.P. Morgan Private Bank's "NextList2025" includes four museums, two wineries, four Broadway shows and 10 books.

item.title: I’ve travelled to 40 countries with my parents. We’re magnets for mishaps — and couldn’t be more grateful
item.description: Near-death experiences in Zimbabwe, road trips to nowhere in Cuba. Media executive Todd Miller details how his family used humor to deal with disasters abroad.

item.title: Salesforce shares rise after earnings beat on revenue, fourth-quarter guidance
item.description: Salesforce reported its fiscal third-quarter earnings on Tuesday and posted strong fourth-quarter guidance.

item.title: Okta shares pop 18% on earnings beat, strong guidance
item.description: Okta shares soared Tuesday after the company reported strong third-quarter results.

item.title: Microsoft faces £1 billion lawsuit in UK for allegedly overcharging rival cloud firms' customers
item.description: Microsoft was accused of unfairly overcharging customers of rival cloud companies including Amazon, Google and Alibaba Cloud in a U.K. lawsuit filed Tuesday.

item.title: South Korean president says he will lift martial law after parliament rejects his declaration
item.description: Lawmakers in the South Korean National Assembly voted to overturn President Yoon Suk Yeol's martial law decree.

item.title: Intel shares slide as Gelsinger exit leaves chipmaker without a 'quick fix'
item.description: Intel shares fell 6% on Tuesday, a day after the chipmaker announced the ouster of CEO Pat Gelsinger.

item.title: OpenAI hires first marketing chief from Coinbase
item.description: OpenAI said on Tuesday that it's hired Kate Rouch from Coinbase as its first chief marketing officer.

item.title: Apple says it uses Amazon's custom AI chips
item.description: Apple is currently using Amazon Web Services' custom AI chips for services like searching and will evaluate if its latest AI chip can be used to pre-train its AI models like Apple Intelligence.

item.title: 'Realistic' green policies good for the U.S., Aramco CEO says, with Trump to return to White House
item.description: Trump has pledged to "end Biden's delays in federal drilling permits and leases that are needed to unleash American oil and natural gas production."

item.title: China's AI balancing act — beating the U.S. but keeping the tech from threatening Beijing's rule
item.description: Prominent AI scientist Max Tegmark said the narrative of a geopolitical battle between the U.S. and China racing to build the smartest AI is a "suicide race."

item.title: Jaguar reveals 'Type 00' concept car, first under controversial new brand identity
item.description: Famed British carmaker Jaguar revealed its new vehicle design direction Monday night with the introduction of an all-electric concept car called "Type 00."

item.title: French lawmakers to hold no-confidence vote against embattled Barnier government on Wednesday
item.description: The motion will be debated at 4 p.m. on Wednesday, expected to be followed by a vote later in the evening.

item.title: BlackRock expanding in private credit, buys HPS Investment Partners for $12 billion
item.description: The deal, which is expected to close in mid-2025, comes during a boom for the private credit space.

item.title: Trump repeats vow to 'block' Nippon Steel's bid for U.S. Steel
item.description: While he made similar statements on the 2024 campaign trail, it was the first time that Trump had spoken about the deal since he won a second presidential term last month.

item.title: South Korea's inflation climbs in November, but misses expectations
item.description: Last week, the bank of Korea cut its headline inflation outlook for 2024 and 2025 to 2.3% and 1.9% respectively, down from 2.5% and 2.1%.

item.title: Art Cashin, New York Stock Exchange fixture for decades, dies at age 83
item.description: Art Cashin was UBS' director of floor operations at the NYSE and a man The Washington Post called "Wall Street's version of Walter Cronkite."

item.title: Asian chip stocks mostly rise, shrugging off new U.S. semiconductor export curbs on China
item.description: Shares of major Asian chip stocks mostly rose on Tuesday, shrugging off the U.S. announcing new emiconductor export controls on China.

item.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk loses bid to get $56 billion pay package reinstated
item.description: Elon Musk's pay package granted in 2018 was the largest compensation plan in U.S. history for a public company executive.

item.title: Fed Governor Waller says he is 'leaning toward' a December rate cut, but worries about inflation
item.description: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller cited recent data indicating that progress on inflation may be "stalling."

item.title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger ousted by board after disastrous performance
item.description: Intel announced Monday that CEO Pat Gelsinger has retired from the company, effective Dec. 1.

item.title: GM to sell stake in battery cell plant to joint venture partner for roughly $1 billion
item.description: General Motors plans to sell its stake in a $2.6 billion electric vehicle battery cell plant in Michigan to its joint venture partner LG Energy Solution.

item.title: Ireland's election delivers pro-business continuity despite voter discontent
item.description: The result shows Ireland is "still open to global companies, and as pro-business as it has been for the last 30 or 40 years."

item.title: Trump's Defense pick, Pete Hegseth, faces new media report on alleged alcohol abuse, sexual impropriety
item.description: Former Fox News host Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of Defense, was investigated in 2017 for an alleged sexual assault.
